adventure_overview: Planet Earth is our home. It provides us with all the things we need to live: air, water, and food. Earth also provides us with natural beauty like mountains, oceans, forests, and waterfalls. All these things are valuable resources that we need. In this Adventure, you will discover the things that you can do to help ensure the resources of Earth are taken care of and respected. Some of these things may seem small. When done by everyone, these small actions impact our world, our home, and the planet Earth. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: Discover the difference between renewable natural resources and non-renewable natural resources.

activities.name: Conservation Card Game
activities.description: Card game sorting into renewable and non-renewable resources.

activities.name: The Great Scatter Relay
activities.description: Cub Scouts sort renewable and non-renewable items in a relay game.

activities.name: Water Pollution Poster
activities.description: Cub Scouts create a poster of how a waterway may become polluted.

requirements.text: Learn about the 3 R’s: Reduce, Reuse, Recycle.

activities.name: Compost Jar
activities.description: Make a composting jar and how using compost connects to the 3 Rs.

activities.name: Three R’s Sorting Relay Race
activities.description: In teams, Cub Scouts will race to sort items into the different 3 R’s categories.

activities.name: Tour Electronic Disposal Center
activities.description: Visit an electronics or appliance disposal center and learn how they take apart items to recycle and reuse.

requirements.text: Discover what happens to the recyclables in your community.

activities.name: Recycle Plant Tour
activities.description: Tour a local recycle management facility.

activities.name: Speak with a Recycling Professional
activities.description: Invite someone from your local recycle management facility to visit your den meeting.

activities.name: Clean Waterways
activities.description: In celebration of the 70th anniversary of the Conservation Good Turn for America, Scouting America is joining the nationwide initiative aimed at addressing the critical issue of waterway and marine debris, “aquatic trash”, offering Scouts the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the health of our waterways and ecosystems.

activities.name: Garden Pollinator
activities.description: Cub Scouts build a pollinator garden.

activities.name: Recycling Roundup
activities.description: Cub Scouts start a recycling program at pack events.
